conversation.message:
Dear Parent_E,

[TALK] Thank you for checking in, and I appreciate your patience.

At this moment, the place at Nursery_E is still unfilled. We are still keeping it under consideration in line with our allocation priorities in case a higher-priority family submits an application in the next round or two. Because of that, I’m not able to confirm an offer to you today or give a guaranteed decision date.

That said, to be as concrete as possible: if no higher-priority application is received by the next round, we will be in a position to reassess immediately and move quickly.

If you want to be ready for rapid processing should we be able to proceed, the most helpful steps are:
1) Confirm your earliest possible start date and preferred schedule (full-time/part-time, days).
2) Ensure you have standard documents ready (ID, proof of address, emergency contact details, immunization/health info as applicable).

You’re welcome to check back next round; if you decide to submit another formal application then, we will review it promptly based on who else (if anyone) has applied.

Kind regards,
Nursery_E Admissions

However, accepting Parent_E now would lock my single seat and prevent matching with Parent_A/Parent_C/Parent_B should they apply in later rounds. Given the objective to match as high as possible on my true priority list and that we are only at round 11 (with many rounds remaining), the optimal strategy is to continue holding the seat for higher-priority parents. History shows Parent_E is persistent and likely to remain available if still unmatched later, so rejecting now preserves the option value of waiting without losing a higher-priority match opportunity.

conversation.message:
Dear Nursery_E Admissions Team,

[APPLY] I’m Parent_E and I would like to formally apply again in round 12 for the remaining place. We remain without another placement and we will accept immediately if offered.

To make it as easy as possible for you to finalize quickly:
- Earliest start date: immediately
- Schedule: full-time Mon–Fri (flexible if you need a different pattern)
- Documents ready today: ID, proof of address, emergency contacts, and health/immunization information

Could you please confirm whether any higher-priority families (Parent_A, Parent_C, or Parent_B) submitted an [APPLY] to you in round 12? If not, what is the exact condition/round at which you would be able to convert this into an offer so we can enroll the same day?

Kind regards,
Parent_E
conversation.thought: Only Nursery_E remains available and it is on my true preference list (last choice but acceptable). Prior rounds show Nursery_E is holding the seat for potential higher-priority applicants; talking hasn’t converted into an offer, so I should submit a clean [APPLY] again while also requesting a concrete decision condition/timing and offering any additional commitments/documents that could let them finalize immediately if no higher-priority applicant applies.

conversation.message:
Dear Parent_E,

Thank you for your round 12 application and for clearly confirming your immediate start date, full-time preference, and that all documents are ready.

For round 12: we have not received an [APPLY] from any higher-priority family (Parent_A, Parent_C, or Parent_B) in this round’s messages to Nursery_E.

On that basis, we are able to proceed and offer you the available place.

[ACCEPT] If you confirm, please reply with your preferred start date (you indicated immediate) and we will send the enrollment steps/forms and document checklist for same-day completion.

Kind regards,
Nursery_E Admissions
conversation.thought: As Nursery_E, my true priority list is A > C > B > E > D, quota 1. Parent_E is a low-priority but acceptable candidate. However, none of my top three (A/C/B) rank Nursery_E highly: A ranks E last; C ranks E last; B ranks E 4th. So it is unlikely they will ever apply unless all other options are gone. Prolonged holding risks ending unmatched by round 30, which is worse than matching with an acceptable parent. Given repeated rounds with only Parent_E contacting and no evidence of higher-priority applicants, accepting now secures a match with an included parent and avoids vacancy risk.
